text:
Crime and Punishment

Look, you all need to dress properly so people see you’re from a good background. I told you, Sonia, the bodice should be longer and made from two pieces. Now look at the kid—totally messed up because of your advice to make it shorter. Ugh, why is everyone crying again? Seriously, what’s wrong? Kolya, get it together. Hurry up! What an annoying kid!

“Cinq sous, cinq sous.”

Great, a cop is here! What does he want?

A policeman was pushing through the crowd. But then, a guy in a fancy coat and a medal on his chest—looked like a big deal—came up and handed Katerina Ivanovna a green three-rouble note without saying a word. He looked genuinely sympathetic. Katerina Ivanovna took it and gave him a polite bow.

“Thank you, kind sir,” she said, sounding all high and mighty. “The reasons we’re here (take the money, Polenka; see? There are good people who help a struggling lady). These orphans are from a good family—maybe even aristocrats—and that awful general was just sitting there eating his fancy meal… and got mad at me for bothering him. ‘Your excellency,’ I said, ‘please help the orphans; you knew my late husband, Semyon Zaharovitch, and on the day he died, a total jerk slandered his only daughter.’ … And now that cop is back! Help me,” she called to the official. “Why is that policeman coming closer? We just got here!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna pleads for help and sympathy from a gentleman while facing trouble with a policeman during a public performance.
